-----Original Message-----
From: sachin gupta [mailto:sachin@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 21, 2001 4:46 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] question regarding setup()


One easy way to achieve this is to define a boolean with initial value true.
You can set this boolean to false during your first run of setup() and you
only execute statements inside setup() if this boolean is true :)

boolean flag = true;

public void setup()
{
	if (flag)
	{
		do setup();
		....
		....
		flag = false;
	}
}

The basic purpose of the setup() method provided in JUnit is to initialize
the variables of testing ground before each  test and that is why it is
being called by the framework before each test.


Sachin



-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Ankarberg [mailto:RyanA@...]
Sent: Thursday, February 22, 2001 8:09 AM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [junit] question regarding setup()


I was noticing that each time a particular test method within my test cases
is called, it in turn calls setup(), each time... How can I go about having
it only call setup() once, when the test case is initialized?
